intro: Hieracium rhabdanthes, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils. It produces small, yellowish to reddish flowers that bloom in the summer months. Hieracium rhabdanthes is often found in disturbed habitats and can spread through rhizomes, making it a persistent weed in certain areas.
